newsitem.title: USA: PDVSA Amuay refinery's catcracker down - trade.
newsitem.headline: PDVSA Amuay refinery's catcracker down - trade.

text.p: Petroleos de Venezuela's (PDVSA) Amuay refinery has taken down a 100,000 barrel per day (bpd) catcracker, after it suffered serious damage, trade sources said Tuesday.
The cause and extent of the damage to the unit was unclear but some estimated potentially long repairs.
"I'm hearing it could be down for two months," said one Gulf Coast trader whose company has dealings with PDVSA.
Another trader said: "It had to do with some compressor problem over the weekend."
The 470,000 bpd refinery, run by PDVSA unit Lagoven, is a major supplier of refined petroleum products to the U.S.
PDVSA could not be immediately contacted for comment.
